2023-03-03.name: Pine Mountain Ski Jumping Tournament
2023-03-03.summary: The tournament in this Upper Peninsula town on the Wisconsin border is where the             international jumpers compete; it's a stop on the Continental Cup circuit.

2023-03-03.name: Oneota Film Festival
2023-03-03.summary: This free festival showcases documentary films and includes dance performances on the campus of Luther College.

2023-03-03.name: Copper Dog 150 sled-dog races
2023-03-03.summary: There's a party atmosphere as the mushers start Friday night along Fifth Street, with music, food trucks and bonfires. Follow the mushers to the finish in Eagle Harbor or stay in Calumet for the Dog House Races, with teams of seven people.

2023-03-03.name: World's Longest Weenie Roast
2023-03-03.summary: Lakewoods Resorts hosts this benefit on Lake Namekagon, which includes snowmobile speed runs, ice bowling, a weenie-eating contest and a frozen weenie polar plunge.

2023-03-03.name: International Festival of Owls
2023-03-03.summary: This southeast Minnesota town offers owl prowls, hooting contests, pellet dissection, live-owl programs and children's activities.

2023-03-03.name: Maple-syrup festivals
2023-03-03.summary: At nature centers around the region, tour the sugarbush and learn how to tap trees and boil sap. Then, eat a pancake breakfast with real maple syrup.

2023-03-03.name: Winter Festival
2023-03-03.summary: The Lake Superior festival features a candlelight ski/snowshoe, polar plunge, botany hike, ice-rescue demo and whitefish-liver feed.

2023-03-04.name: Pine Mountain Ski Jumping Tournament
2023-03-04.summary: The tournament in this Upper Peninsula town on the Wisconsin border is where the             international jumpers compete; it's a stop on the Continental Cup circuit.

2023-03-04.name: Bock Fest
2023-03-04.summary: There's a parade of mythical Germanic characters, a hunt for billy-goat heads on the Schell Brewery grounds and beyond and a big party afterward with beer, live music and a bonfire.

2023-03-04.name: Oneota Film Festival
2023-03-04.summary: This free festival showcases documentary films and includes dance performances on the campus of Luther College.

2023-03-04.name: Artigras
2023-03-04.summary: This fine arts festival in KI Convention Center includes artist demonstrations, children's activities, dance, jazz and classical music.

2023-03-10.name: Canoecopia
2023-03-10.summary: It's the world's largest paddlesports expo, according to host Rutabaga, with dozens of demonstrations, workshops and presentations plus discounts on boats and gear.

2023-03-11.name: St. Patrick's Day parade
2023-03-11.summary: The big parade starts at noon, starting at Third and Wisconsin downtown and followed by music, dancing and pipes and drums at the Irish Cultural and Heritage Center.

2023-03-11.name: St. Patrick's Day Parade
2023-03-11.summary: The parade starts at 12:30 p.m. and proceeds along Columbus Drive past Grant Park. The river dying is from the east side of the bridge at Columbus Drive or upper and lower Wacker Drive between Columbus and Lake Shore Drive. The water stays green for about five hours.

2023-03-11.name: St. Patrick's Day celebrations
2023-03-11.summary: St. Patrick's Day parades and parties are being held all over the region, and a few St. Urho Day celebrations, too.

2023-03-17.name: St. Patrick's Day Parade
2023-03-17.summary: In this traditionally Irish city, the parade starts at noon and heads along Fifth Street from Rice Park to Mears Park.

2023-03-17.name: Minneapolis St. Patrick's Day Parade
2023-03-17.summary: The parade begins at 6 p.m. and is followed by a Barney Blast party.

2023-03-17.name: St. Patrick's Day Festival
2023-03-17.summary: In northwest Iowa, this is the state's Irish capital, and it celebrates with many festivities, including a parade at 1:30 p.m. Saturday.

2023-03-18.summary: This free festival at the Hjemkomst Center includes two entertainment stages, heritage programs, arts and crafts, interactive booths and Celtic food and treats.

2023-03-18.summary: This Brainerd Lakes town celebrates with a 2 p.m. parade and a party.
